title: Speech Development Program: Early Phonological Skills

activities.title: Animal Sound Safari
activities.description: A fun game where children identify animals and practice their sounds, focusing on challenging phonemes.
instructions: Display animal pictures one at a time
Child names the animal and makes its sound
For animals with target sounds (like 'lion' for 'l'), practice the sound in isolation
Use the mirror to show proper tongue position
Have child create sentences about the animal using the target sound
adaptations: Simplify: Focus only on identifying sounds, not producing them
Challenge: Create short stories using multiple animals with target sounds
activities.homeActivity: Create a simple animal sound book with pictures from magazines

progress.baseline: Can identify but struggles to produce 'r' and 'l' sounds
progress.goal: Correctly produce target sounds in isolation and in simple words

activities.title: Sound Detective
activities.description: Children become sound detectives, finding and identifying sounds in words.
instructions: Give child a 'detective kit' with a magnifying glass and letter cards
Present a picture and ask the child to find the first sound
Child uses the magnifying glass to 'search' for the sound
Once identified, child finds the matching letter card
Progress to finding ending sounds and middle sounds
Create a 'sound map' showing the sequence of sounds in words
adaptations: Simplify: Focus only on initial sounds with obvious phonemes
Challenge: Break words into all component sounds and blend them together
activities.homeActivity: Sound scavenger hunt - find objects at home that start with target sounds

progress.baseline: Can identify initial sounds in simple words
progress.goal: Isolate and identify all sounds in CVC words (consonant-vowel-consonant)

activities.title: Word Builder Workshop
activities.description: Building vocabulary through categorization, description, and word relationships.
instructions: Present category boxes labeled with themes (animals, food, actions)
Give child word cards to sort into categories
For each word, encourage child to provide a synonym or related word
Show scene pictures and encourage descriptive sentences
Create a 'word web' connecting related concepts
adaptations: Simplify: Use fewer categories with more concrete distinctions
Challenge: Add abstract categories and ask for multiple associations
activities.homeActivity: Category hunt - find items around the house that fit various categories

progress.baseline: Uses basic vocabulary with limited descriptive words
progress.goal: Employ varied vocabulary including descriptive adjectives and specific nouns

activities.title: Story Sequence Blocks
activities.description: Developing narrative skills through visual sequencing and storytelling.
instructions: Present a series of picture cards showing a simple story sequence
Ask child to arrange them in correct order
Use story blocks labeled with 'beginning,' 'middle,' and 'end'
Guide child to tell what happens in each part of the story
Introduce puppets to act out the story
Help child expand the story with more details and dialogue
adaptations: Simplify: Use fewer sequence cards with clear actions
Challenge: Have child create original stories with a clear structure
activities.homeActivity: Create a 'day in the life' picture sequence of the child's daily routine

progress.baseline: Tells simple stories without clear sequence or details
progress.goal: Creates cohesive narratives with beginning, middle, end, and descriptive elements

activities.title: Rhyme Time
activities.description: Engaging with rhyming words through active games and visual supports.
instructions: Start with a rhyming song or nursery rhyme
Show picture pairs that rhyme and have child identify the matching sound
Play 'rhyme catch' - say a word and toss ball to child who must respond with a rhyme
Create word family charts (-at, -op, -ing) and find pictures that match
Encourage child to generate their own rhymes
adaptations: Simplify: Focus on identification of rhymes rather than production
Challenge: Create silly rhyming stories together
activities.homeActivity: Rhyming scavenger hunt with common household items

progress.baseline: Can identify obvious rhymes but struggles to generate them
progress.goal: Independently produce rhyming words and identify word families

milestones.notes: Can produce 'r' and 'l' in simple words with support
Beginning to identify initial sounds consistently
Improved sound isolation in simple words
Can blend CVC words with visual support
Beginning to use more descriptive adjectives
Uses simple sentence structure in stories
Beginning to include clear beginning and end
Stories now include characters, setting, and basic plot

resources.title: Sound Production Cards
resources.description: Visual cards showing mouth positioning for challenging sounds

resources.title: Phonemic Awareness Games
resources.description: Digital games focusing on sound manipulation and blending

resources.title: Parent's Guide to Supporting Speech at Home
resources.description: Practical strategies for reinforcing speech skills in daily activities

resources.title: Vocabulary Building Picture Dictionary
resources.description: Age-appropriate picture dictionary with key vocabulary

dailyPractice: Incorporate 5-10 minutes of sound practice during bath time or driving
Play 'I Spy' games focusing on sounds and vocabulary
Read stories with rhyming patterns and encourage prediction
Narrate daily activities to model complete sentences and vocabulary
supportStrategies: Model correct pronunciation without requiring repetition
Expand child's utterances into complete sentences
Provide positive reinforcement for communication attempts
Create a language-rich environment with varied vocabulary
redFlags: Frustration or avoidance during communication attempts
Lack of progress after consistent practice
